directoryOverview: Business layer for patient encounter logging, case review, and clinical education tracking.

files.summary: Data model for a clinical case review record including reviewer, comments, course outcome, and closure metadata; also contains LearnerReviewInfo.
files.businessPurpose: Holds all fields needed to record a supervisor's case review and a learner's self-review response for a submitted patient log encounter.

files.summary: Manager for case review workflows including fetching submitted/reviewed cases, saving supervisor and learner reviews, and closing cases.
files.businessPurpose: Provides all data access for the case review lifecycle: listing cases for review, saving review details, recording learner acknowledgment, and closing reviewed cases.
keyMethods: GetCasesReviewedByUser - list cases pending supervisor review
GetPatientCasesToReviewCount - count pending reviews for dashboard

files.summary: Data model for a patient log diagnosis classification (Education DX) with validation logic.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a department-level diagnosis classification entry used to categorize patient encounters, with built-in uniqueness and required-field validation.
keyMethods: Validate - checks name required and uniqueness

files.summary: Manager for diagnosis classification (Education DX) CRUD operations with cache invalidation and event raising.
files.businessPurpose: Provides full lifecycle management of patient log diagnosis classifications including search, save, update, delete, restore, and duplicate checking.
keyMethods: FetchEducationDXInfo - load single record by ID

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for filtering education diagnosis classifications by department, user, patient log, page mode, and deleted status.
files.businessPurpose: Encapsulates filter parameters passed to EducationDXManager queries to support admin listing and patient log view modes.

files.summary: Data model for a patient log encounter type (competence level) with name, description, sort order, and validation.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a department-level encounter type used to classify patient encounters by clinical competency, with built-in uniqueness and required-field validation.
keyMethods: Validate - checks name required and uniqueness

files.summary: Manager for encounter type CRUD operations with cache invalidation, event raising, and name-to-ID lookup.
files.businessPurpose: Provides full lifecycle management of patient log encounter types including search, save, update, delete, restore, duplicate checking, and ID resolution by name for import.
keyMethods: GetEncounterTypeIdByName - resolve name to ID for import

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for filtering encounter types by department, user, patient log, page mode, and deleted status.
files.businessPurpose: Encapsulates filter parameters passed to EncounterTypeManager queries to support admin listing and patient log view modes.

files.summary: Data model holding start/end date range for a patient log export request with basic date validation.
files.businessPurpose: Carries the date range parameters submitted by users when exporting patient log data to Excel, CSV, XML, XSL, or Access formats.
keyMethods: Validate - checks start and end dates are provided

files.summary: Manager that exports patient log data to multiple formats (Excel, CSV, XML, XSL, Access) with PII decryption for DOB and MRN fields.
files.businessPurpose: Handles all patient log export workflows by fetching data with decrypted PII, then writing output files in the requested format for download.
keyMethods: GetDataForpatientLogsExport - fetch and decrypt export data
CreateMDB - copy Access template for export

files.summary: Data model for a single patient log row parsed from an import file, containing all encounter and procedure fields.
files.businessPurpose: Holds the raw string fields extracted from a CSV import row before resolution and validation by ImportPatientLogManager.

files.summary: Manager that resolves import row data (names to IDs, lookups) and calls PatientLogManager to persist each imported patient log record.
files.businessPurpose: Orchestrates the full patient log import pipeline: resolving user, supervisor, procedure, location, and DX IDs by name, then persisting valid rows while collecting error messages for invalid ones.
keyMethods: ImportpatientLog - resolve and save one import row
GetUserIdByFirstAndLastName - resolve resident/supervisor name to ID
GetProcedureIDByName - resolve procedure name to ID
GetEncounterTypeIdByName - resolve encounter type name to ID
GetLocationIdByName - resolve location name to ID

files.summary: Data model for a patient log location name with ID, department, name, sort order, and uniqueness validation.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a department-configured clinical location (e.g., ER, ICU) used to tag patient encounters, with built-in duplicate checking.
keyMethods: Validate - checks name required and uniqueness

files.summary: Manager for patient log location name CRUD operations with cache invalidation, event raising, and name-to-ID lookup.
files.businessPurpose: Provides full lifecycle management of clinical locations including search, save, update, delete, restore, and ID resolution by name for import workflows.
keyMethods: GetLocationIdByName - resolve name to ID for import

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for filtering location names by department, user, patient log, page mode, and deleted status.
files.businessPurpose: Encapsulates filter parameters passed to LocationNameManager queries to support admin listing and patient log view modes.

files.summary: Data model for a patient log field group with ID, name, required flag, and hidden flag.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a logical grouping of custom patient log fields that can be shown/hidden or marked required at the department level.

files.summary: Data model for a configurable patient log field with display settings, field type, bounds, lookup, and validation.
files.businessPurpose: Represents one custom field definition on the patient log form, supporting field configuration (visibility, required, type, bounds) per department.
keyMethods: Validate - checks field name required and uniqueness

files.summary: Manager for patient log field group configuration: setting hidden/required flags and swapping display order.
files.businessPurpose: Allows administrators to control field group visibility, required status, and ordering on the patient log form at the department level.

files.summary: Manager for patient log custom field configuration: fetching fields for rendering, setting flags, swapping order, and CRUD for field definitions.
files.businessPurpose: Provides complete management of configurable patient log fields including retrieval with caching, visibility/required flag toggling, reordering, and field CRUD operations.
keyMethods: GetPatientLogsFieldsToDraw - fetch fields for form rendering

files.summary: Primary data model for a submitted patient log encounter including patient demographics, encounter details, supervisor, diagnoses, and custom field values.
files.businessPurpose: Represents the complete patient encounter record submitted by a resident, holding all standard and custom fields required for persistence and reporting.

files.summary: Data model for a custom lookup list used by patient log fields, including the list header and its collection of lookup values.
files.businessPurpose: Represents a named dropdown list configurable per department, used to populate custom lookup-type fields on the patient log form.
keyMethods: Validate - checks lookup name required and uniqueness

files.summary: Manager for patient log custom lookup list CRUD using transactional operations to save/update the list header and all its items atomically.
files.businessPurpose: Manages custom dropdown lists for patient log fields, persisting header and items in a single transaction to maintain list integrity.
keyMethods: Save - create lookup with items in transaction
Update - update lookup and items in transaction
FetchLookUpValues - load items for a lookup

files.summary: Core manager for patient log submission, search, status updates, acceptance workflow, and dynamic SQL report generation.
files.businessPurpose: Orchestrates the full patient log lifecycle including submission, search with pagination, supervisor review status updates, bulk acceptance, and dynamic SQL construction for flexible reporting.
keyMethods: GetPatientLogDetailedData - fetch report data with dynamic SQL
GetPatientLogSubmittedInfo - data reader for report view

files.summary: Manager for patient log reporting with a rich filter model (PatientLogReportFilter) supporting age groups, diagnoses, encounter types, locations, supervisors, and saved report settings.
files.businessPurpose: Provides data retrieval and filter state management for the patient log report page, supporting multi-dimensional filtering, saved report preferences, and archived data views.
keyMethods: GetPatientLogReport - fetch report data by filter

files.summary: Search criteria DTO for patient log queries with pagination, sorting, supervisor filter, date range, and patient search text.
files.businessPurpose: Encapsulates all filter and pagination parameters for PatientLogManager search methods, including supervisor review status and free-text patient lookup.

files.summary: Serializable data model for a patient log supervisor with change-tracking flags (new, deleted, updated, DB entry).
files.businessPurpose: Represents a supervisor assigned to patient log review with state flags used by PatientLogSupervisorsManager to determine which records to insert or delete.

files.summary: Manager for patient log supervisor assignments including fetching, saving, deleting, and verifying active supervisor status.
files.businessPurpose: Manages the list of supervisors eligible to review patient logs for a department, supporting add/remove operations and checking if a supervisor is currently active.
keyMethods: GetSupervisorsListForEdit - list with user type filter
GetUserType - fetch user type for IDs

files.summary: Minimal DTO holding a procedure name and ID for use in patient log procedure selection UI.
files.businessPurpose: Provides a simple name/id pair used to populate procedure selection dropdowns when submitting a patient log with associated procedures.

files.summary: Configuration DTO controlling whether a maximum submission age limit is enforced for patient log entries.
files.businessPurpose: Holds department-level customization settings that restrict how many days after the encounter date a resident can submit a patient log.
